description.narrative: 2B.2.1 Capacity of health services and CSOs to promote and provide a com plete and integrated package of health & nutrition services appropriate to different target groups and levels strengthened (UNFPA, UNICEF, WHO), which contributes to Child Health, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2B. Health, Population, Nutrition. Health of the population is improved: 2B.1 Effective Health System 2B.2 Health practices and Quality of healt h services

participating-org.narrative: RULI DISTRICT HOSPITAL ARCHIDIOCESE DE KIGALI

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Community and home based maternal and newborn care
Immunization supply chain, including cold chain
Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
Technical assistance - Maternal and newborn health

title.narrative: Rwanda United Nations Development Assistance Framework 2013-2018
Rwanda United Nations Development Assistance Framework 2018-2023
UNICEF Programmes in Rwanda (Humanitarian action and Emergencies)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Rwanda 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2B.2.1 Capacity of health services and CSOs to promote and provide a com plete and integrated package of health & nutrition services appropriate to different target groups and levels strengthened (UNFPA, UNICEF, WHO)
Number of new vaccines introduced into the country
Population/community based events reaching targeted groups with critical life saving interventions conducted (VAS, measles SIA, deworming).
Proportion of Imidugudu (villages) providing newborn home based care package on childhood killer diseases in 6 supported districts.
Proportion of children 6 to 23 months old receiving >90 Micronutrient package (MNP) sachets per year in 6 districts.
Proportion of districts with a regular monitoring (reporting and feedback) system using RapidSMS to track health & nutrition outcomes within the "1000 days period".
Proportion of imidugudu (villages) with trained CHWs (binomes) on CBN/IYCF as per national guidelines in 9 districts.
Proportion of deliveries assisted by skilled attendants in 6 supported districts.
Proportion of health facilities managing rehabilitation with no stock out of therapeutic milk in health facilities.
